symptoms.name: Skin sores
symptoms.severity: Variable, can range from mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Can be single or multiple, hypopigmented or reddish patches

symptoms.name: Nerve damage
symptoms.severity: Variable, can lead to muscle weakness and loss of sensation
symptoms.pattern: Peripheral nerve involvement, potentially leading to disability

symptoms.name: Muscle weakness
symptoms.pattern: Affects muscles supplied by affected nerves

symptoms.name: Painful rash
symptoms.pattern: Erythematous rash, can progress to involve trunk and face

symptoms.name: Macules
symptoms.pattern: Violaceous, nonblanching macules coalescing into patches

physical_findings: Loss of sensation in affected areas
Diffuse dermal infiltrate composed of disorganized aggregates of foamy histiocytes and lymphocytes
Acid-fast bacilli within histiocytes and cutaneous nerve twigs
risk_factors: Prolonged close contact with untreated individuals

required: At least one of the following: definite loss of sensation in a pale (hypopigmented) or reddish skin patch; thickened or enlarged peripheral nerve, with loss of sensation and/or weakness of the muscles supplied by that nerve; microscopic detection of bacilli in a slit-skin smear
supportive: Positive lepromin skin test (differentiates forms, not diagnostic)
